io.elegie.luchess.pgn.impl.grammars

Interface Grammar

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MoveGrammar, SimpleGameGrammar

    public interface Grammar

    A Grammar aggregates some PGN entities (tokens) into a bigger PGN entity. For instance, a simple move could be defined by a move number, followed by a dot, followed by a move value: 1.e4.

    Grammars are associated to Parsers. Thus, a move parser will be associated to a move grammar, which recognizes strings like 'e4', 'Nf3+'. Similarly, a game parser will be associated to a game grammar, which includes more complicated PGN entities, like headers, comments, variations and so forth.

    The rules to which all grammars must abide have been defined in the PGN specification, which identifies all PGN tokens, and in which context they may be used.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Token getRoot()
      Each grammar can be viewed as a tree, made of PGN tokens.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        Token getRoot()
        Each grammar can be viewed as a tree, made of PGN tokens. This method returns the one and only root of the grammar, which generally has a set of children which can be navigated by a parser.
        Returns:
        Root token of the grammar
